section.section: Subject to the provisions of paragraph (2) of this subsection, a credit union may borrow money for the purchase of fixed assets.

The term of the loan may not exceed:
15 years for borrowings secured by real or leasehold property; and
5 years for borrowings secured by other fixed assets.

text.section:
A credit union may borrow money for a purpose other than the purchase of fixed assets as long as the total borrowing does not exceed the greater of:
Two times the net worth of the borrowing credit union; or
10% of the total assets of the borrowing credit union.
